intro: Kosteletzkya digitata, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant thrives in saline and sandy environments, often found along shorelines and dunes. Its structure includes a woody stem with alternate, lobed leaves. Kosteletzkya digitata is often used in coastal landscaping due to its salt tolerance and ornamental value.
